definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: He had cleared them out three years ago but they had all come back in again.
sentences.chinese: 祂三年前曾经把他们赶出去，但不久又回复旧观。

sentences.english: The enemy are in the forest and must be dislodged .
sentences.chinese: 敌人在丛林里，必须将他们赶出来。

sentences.english: The hecklers were banished from the courtroom.
I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.
sentences.chinese: 我请过你的门徒把鬼赶出去，他们却是不能。

sentences.english: I was obliged to confess, and in recompense for my cowardice and inhumanity was sent out of the house.
sentences.chinese: 作为对我的懦弱和不友好的赏罚，我被赶出了房子。

sentences.english: So they drove Boner out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他们把邦德赶出了家门。

sentences.english: I know we were moved because of the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我们被赶出来是因为世界杯。

sentences.english: He hunted his pet dog out of his house.
Small qian to block has angered the master yoda, more is out of the clear temple.
sentences.chinese: 小倩欲阻止却惹怒了尤达大师，更被赶出导明寺。

sentences.english: So, she used her magic and kept the villagers out of the forest; the two love birds were hence well protected.
sentences.chinese: 于是，施法将村民们赶出了森林，保护了这对恋人。

sentences.english: I kicked him out. Now he wants in the house.
sentences.chinese: 我把他赶出去了，现在他想进屋里来。

sentences.english: Do you think he ought to be taken out of his school and sent to the penitentiary ?
sentences.chinese: 你们难道认为他应该被赶出校门，送进教养院？

sentences.english: Following the man's release, Christ went straight back across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 基督赶出污鬼之后，又直接渡海回去。

sentences.english: They unharnessed the horses and turned them out to grass.
sentences.chinese: 他们解下马具，把马赶出去吃草。

sentences.english: I had a relatively large report due that I was too busy to start until the last minute, but it looks like I got it all squared away.
sentences.chinese: 你是说虽然等到最后一分钟，但还是赶出来了？

sentences.english: On only 10% of occasions were queue-jumpers physically ejected from the line.
sentences.chinese: 只有10%的场合，“插队者”被从队列中赶出来。

definition: to drive away/to force out/to repel
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to drive (vehicle)/to drive out/to chase away/to herd (people towards a gate)
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
